summary_comment: Professor Post is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, known for being extremely knowledgeable and taking the time to explain concepts thoroughly with examples. His courses are well-structured and communicated, incorporating useful teaching tools at regular intervals. However, students note that familiarity with Apple computers is beneficial due to the specific software and tools used in his lectures.
summary_comment_short: Professor Post is highly regarded for his excellent teaching quality, being both knowledgeable and thorough in his explanations and examples. He effectively structures his courses and communicates them well, though students note that some tools and programs work best on Apple computers.

Ratings.comment: So nice 100% great

Very knowledgeable on the course subject matter. 
Takes his time explaining, giving examples, and working with his students.
Great teacher!

The course was structured and communicated well. The lectures would continuously contain useful teaching tools and he would run through one about every 3 slides. You may want to have an apple computer as Dr. Post uses only that OS. Therefore, some programs or tools were not free or as easy to use on a Microsoft OS. Wants you to learn and b informed

summary_comment: Professor Foste is an outstanding instructor deeply immersed in his expertise, making his teachings both engaging and informative. He is unequivocally skilled at imparting knowledge, making him a highly effective teacher.
summary_comment_short: Professor Foste is an outstanding instructor, deeply immersed in his expertise, and effectively communicates complex concepts to students. His teaching quality is highly regarded by his students.

Ratings.comment: Awesome prof. He is TOTALLY immersed in his expertise. Definitely, a person who teaches well.

summary_comment: Professor Barnes offers a fun and accessible class with minimal exams but a heavy workload in weekly short papers and bi-weekly longer papers, along with monthly group projects that contribute to the final project. The class requires active participation, particularly a strong commitment to reading, as discussions can feel awkward without it. Overall, the class is described as easy if one keeps up with the reading and assignments.
summary_comment_short: Professor Barnes offers a fun and easy class with minimal exams but a heavy workload in weekly and bi-weekly papers, and monthly group projects leading up to a final project. The class requires consistent engagement with the reading material to participate effectively.

Ratings.comment: Fun easy class. You should do the reading otherwise it's kinda awkward everyone but you is talking. You have to go. No exams but lots of little assignments like a one pg paper every week and every other week like 2pg paper and little group projects like once a month that work together for the final proj thats super easy.

summary_comment: Professor Wild receives overwhelmingly negative feedback for her teaching quality at Ohio State. Students criticize her for being hypocritical, having poor communication, unclear grading criteria, and an unwillingness to address feedback. The class is seen as unengaging and repetitive despite the professor's extensive knowledge.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wild is widely regarded as having poor teaching effectiveness, with students citing her as the worst professor they have encountered at Ohio State due to her inconsistent communication, unclear grading criteria, and unresponsive nature to feedback. Her classes are described as lengthy and repetitive, with little engagement or usefulness, despite her possessing a wealth of knowledge.

Ratings.comment: Worst professor I've had at Ohio State. She teaches inclusion, but on the first day of class threatened to fail me because I fidgeted too much. Hypocritical. She has poor communication skills, so if class changes, she won't let you know. Grading criteria was always pretty unclear. She is also very unresponsive to feedback. DO NOT RECOMMEND

The class isn't difficult, but it's not super helpful or useful either. She never really taught. Lots of work. If you do it, you'll get an A. She has a lot of knowledge, but the class was long and repetitive. Overall, easy, just not engaging or exciting.

summary_comment: Professor Cutshall is known for her easy-to-follow and manageable class structure, making it a straightforward way to boost GPA with minimal effort outside of completing weekly assignments. She offers flexible deadlines, including leniency for late submissions, and her grading is very lenient, especially on projects. Students appreciate her engaging discussions and recommend her class highly for its positive impact on both academic performance and personal growth.
summary_comment_short: Professor Cutshall is known for her easy-to-follow classes that serve as a reliable GPA booster, with well-outlined assignments and lenient late submission policies. Students appreciate her easy grading and the opportunity to work ahead, though the final project requires more effort compared to other assignments.

Ratings.comment: Easy GPA booster class for 3 credit hours, I only spent like less than an hour completing the 2 weekly assignments. Other than the final project which did take some extra time it wasn't bad and easy since its a topic about yourself basically. I turned in my final project late a bit but I got full credit and I am just happy she takes all late work.

Jessica is a fantastic option to take for the online section of this class. Everything is outlined well ahead of time allowing you to work ahead if you wish to do so. There is a decent amount of projects to do, but she grades extremely easy on all of them. Only need the book to study for the midterm. Would definitely recommend this course.

Jessica was an awesome instructor! We had really interesting discussions in her class and the assignments were interesting. I have recommended this class to all of my  friends. Through the course I gained confidence in myself & truly feel like my college skills were improved. Love her!

summary_comment: Professor Pealer is highly regarded for his deep knowledge and passion for golf, effectively engaging students and helping them improve their game. His one-on-one coaching is particularly praised for its effectiveness and personal care. Students consistently report significant improvements and a greater appreciation for the sport under his guidance.
summary_comment_short: Professor Pealer is an outstanding instructor with deep knowledge of golf, significantly enhancing students' understanding and skills. His dedication to one-on-one coaching and personalized attention clearly contributes to substantial improvements in students' games.

Ratings.comment: Made me fall in love with the game even more. Great knowledge and insight, if you have questions ask them. He is great with 1 on 1 coaching and cares if you do about improving your game.

Scott is very knowledgeable about golf and I learned a lot from him. From the times I did have 1 on 1 time he helped my game a lot. The golf simulator was very cool, but unfortunately often a long line often was present, so I found my time was better spent continuing to hit in the bays. I do wish we hadnt spent as much time on the short game.
Amazing instructor, took the class twice just cause I could, easily taken 10 strokes off my 9-hole rounds.

summary_comment: Professor Edmiston's teaching quality varies widely according to student feedback. Some students find him highly engaging and caring, while others describe him as self-centered, lacking empathy, and potentially harmful, particularly regarding cultural sensitivity and personal information sharing.
summary_comment_short: Professor Edmiston is highly regarded by some students for his passionate approach to teaching and advocacy for educational excellence, but others find him lacking in empathy and supportive qualities, perceiving him as self-centered and potentially harmful, especially when it comes to handling sensitive issues.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Edmiston is one of the worst professors that I have had during my time at Ohio State. He lacks empathy and will neglect to acknowledge you when challenges arise. Dr. Edmiston is extremely self-centered and seems to only be teaching the course for his personal benefit. I would not recommend due to his harsh beliefs and unwillingness to be kind.
Awesome professor. He cares deeply about education and about his students. I loved him so much I took him for another class.

The pedagogy he advocates for is amazing. Professionally, Do not trust him. So, if you tell him about a weakness you have, it will come back and bite you and he will make remarks using the info you gave him against you.  Zero Understanding of other culutres. Never open up to him or trust him. His attitudes vary between racist, sexist and ablist
You will love being in class!

summary_comment: Professor Brady is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality and strong commitment to her students' success. She goes above and beyond to provide support and create a comfortable learning environment, fostering close relationships with her students. Her classes are well-structured and engaging, with a focus on practical application and resource provision.
summary_comment_short: Professor Brady is highly regarded for her dedication to her students, providing extensive support and creating a comfortable learning environment. Her classes are praised for their clarity and the wealth of resources offered, though they also encourage students to think critically and embrace new ideas.

Ratings.comment: Anna was great. Cared very much about each individual student and was there if you literally needed any help with anything. The class itself was easy. Assignments were very cut-and-dry and had specific instructions, which made it easy to complete. Some extra credit provided. I actually finished with higher than 100% in the course. Great teacher!

I adored Anna and so did everyone else in my class. Not only did her and I become close, but the whole class felt comfortable with each other. She recommended me for a job within the success center at OSU. She was very informative, passionate, and excited about her material and really, really cared about her students.

I loved Anna! She is very quirky and has a lot to say about time management and organization and provides a lot of resources. The class is good if you have your mind open to change... you will learn a lot.

summary_comment: Professor Iler is known for making her classes engaging and thought-provoking, though her courses require significant reading and frequent quizzes without much feedback. Students appreciate her relaxed demeanor and kindness, but some find the workload heavy and the grading system challenging. Overall, opinions vary, with some recommending her class while others prefer alternative instructors.
summary_comment_short: Professor Iler is highly regarded for making the class engaging despite the heavy reading load, and students appreciate her relaxed teaching style and kindness. However, some students find the class demanding and criticize the frequent quizzes without much feedback, as well as the midterm exam format.

Ratings.comment: Going into this class I assumed that I was going to hate it. But, Dr. Iler really does a good job at making the class interesting. You will have to read every week though. But, this is college so you should expect to read. She is very nice and she is not strict at all she was a very relaxed professor which I really liked. You should take her class!
Great class that really got me thinking and great teacher!
I have really enjoyed being in Professor Ilers class this semester! Im hoping I get to take another course with her in the future.
A lot of work but I learned a lot.

Honestly just a rude person in general. She always makes me feel like an idiot. She also assumes you know everything there is to know about American History. Tons of weekly reading; WAY too much for a 3 credit hour class. Take this class with another professor if you can.

I would enjoy the class more if I was not worried about the weekly quizzes that are anywhere from 25-100 points (only essay questions btw). Very rarely do you receive feedback on these quizzes. Midterm exam was terrible 3 short answer and one essay question. Just never know what she is looking for in my answers
I am dying, although sometimes Dr Iler is kind.
NO EXAMS AT ALL- one midterm paper, one final project, all group discussions in class

summary_comment: Professor Cowgill is highly regarded for his laid-back and engaging teaching style, which fosters a relaxed and discussion-based learning environment. Students appreciate his fairness in grading and his understanding approach to emergencies, making the course manageable despite its initial intimidating syllabus. Overall, his classes are recommended for their comfort and ease.
summary_comment_short: Professor Cowgill, known as Kyler, is highly regarded for his laid-back and humorous teaching style, creating a relaxed and discussion-based learning environment. Students appreciate his fairness in grading and his understanding approach to emergencies, finding his class both comfortable and effective for deepening their understanding of the subject matter.

Ratings.comment: This class is a breeze. Kyler is so laid back and hilarious. The class is super chill and almost all discussion based. There are a lot of projects/papers back to back, but they are graded super easily. 10/10 recommend!

I loved Kyler and his class! Nice guy, and very fair when grading. If you have an emergency and miss class, just let him know and he won't take points off your attendance grade. Take him if you get the chance!

Kyler is a great guy. He is very quiet, but effective. Our class was discussion based, and I felt through these discussions that my classmates and I became very close. It was a comfortable atmosphere all because of him. He really puts things into perspective. The syllabus may seem scary, but trust me, he's very laid back. And grades really easy.
